entry.title: Government takeover of stake in Amulsar gold mine delayed: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Government takeover of stake in Amulsar gold mine delayed: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç UATE, an Armenia-based organization representing more than 150 tech companies, warned law enforcement‚Äôs raid on the taxi company GG is fueling concern for foreign investors. üìç The Armenian government set a new deadline for plans to take a 12.5% stake in the long-stalled Amulsar gold mine project, which was initially set to be finalized by the end of March, but has now been pushed back to September 1 due to ‚Äútechnical problems.‚Äù üìç The government is in talks with Masdar, the Emirati state-owned renewable energy company, in an effort to salvage a major solar power plant deal. The project‚Äôs fate was thrown into doubt last month when the state investment fund ANIF was dissolved.

entry.title: Armenia recognizes Palestine, reaffirms support for two-state solution

media:group.media:title: Armenia recognizes Palestine, reaffirms support for two-state solution
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia officially recognized the state of Palestine, reaffirming its support for a two-state solution. üìç U.S. Secretary of State Blinken pushes Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev to reach a normalization deal with Armenia without delay. üìç Armenia's foreign minister skips a meeting of the CSTO military alliance to visit Lithuania and meet with Belarus's opposition leader. üìç Ambassador Nina Hachigian talks US local diplomacy and supporting democracies- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aG_W4HiH9pE

entry.title: Ambassador Nina Hachigian talks US local diplomacy and supporting democracies

media:group.media:title: Ambassador Nina Hachigian talks US local diplomacy and supporting democracies
media:group.media:description:
Ambassador Nina Hachigian, U.S. Special Representative for City and State Diplomacy, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about the State Department‚Äôs engagement with local officials around the world, including new efforts in Armenia. They also discuss the state of relations between Washington and Yerevan more broadly, as well as what it means personally for Armenian Americans like Ambassador Hachigian to work on these issues.
0:00 ‚ÄòSubnational diplomacy‚Äô at the State Department 2:46 Connecting U.S. and Armenian local officials 5:17 ‚ÄòDigital lessons‚Äô from Los Angeles for Yerevan 7:22 Continuity of U.S. foreign policy on Armenia 9:03 What is the new Local Democracy Forum? 12:40 Representing the U.S. in Armenia as a diasporan
